questions.question: What is the form of government of the United States?
What is the supreme law of the land?
wrongAnswers: The executive branch of the government.

questions.question: Name one thing the U.S. Constitution does.
answers: It defines the parts of the government.
It protects the rights of the people.
wrongAnswers: Establishes the size of the Supreme Court.

questions.question: The U.S. Constitution starts with the the words 'We the People'. What does 'We the People' mean?
wrongAnswers: A centralized government should govern the people.
The people should follow the will of the state.

questions.question: How are changes made to the U.S. Constitution?
What does the Bill of Rights protect?
answers: (The basic) rights of people living in the United States.
wrongAnswers: The powers of the federal government.
The powers of the President and their cabinet.

questions.question: How many amendments does the U.S. Consitution have?
Why is the Declaration of Independence important?
answers: It says America is free from British control.
It says all people are created equal.
wrongAnswers: It defines the different branches of the US government.
It separates the powers between church and state.

questions.question: What founding document said the American colonies were free from Britain?
Name an important idea from the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution. (Know at least 2 of them.)
wrongAnswers: Establishment of a British-American trade deal.

questions.question: The words 'Life, Liberty, and the pursuit of Happiness' are in what founding document?
What is the economic system of the United States?
What is the rule of law?
answers: No one is above the law
wrongAnswers: Some people are above the law.

questions.question: Many documents influenced the U.S. Constitution. Name one.
There are three branches of government. Why?
answers: So one part of the government does not become too powerful.
To establish a system of checks and balances.
To create a separation of power.

questions.question: Name the three branches of government.
answers: Congress, the president, and the courts

questions.question: The President of the United States is in charge of which branch of government?
What part of the federal government writes laws?
What are the two parts of the U.S. Congress?
Name one power of the U.S. Congress
How many U.S. Senators are there?
How long is a term for a U.S. Senator?
What is one of your state's U.S. Senator now? Answers depend on your state.
How many voting members are in the House of Representatives?
How long is a term for a member of the House of Representatives?
Why do U.S. representatives serve shorter terms than U.S. senators?
answers: To more closely follow public opinion.

questions.question: How many senators does each state have?
Why does each state have two senators?
Name your U.S. representative.
What is the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives now?
Who does a U.S. senator represent?
Who elects U.S. Senators?
Who does a member of the House of Representatives represent?
Who elects members of the House of Representatives?
Some states have more representatives than other states. Why?
answers: Because some states have more people.

questions.question: The President of the United States is elected for how many years?
The President of the United States can serve only two terms. Why?
answers: To keep the president from becoming too powerful.

questions.question: What is the name of the President of the United States now?
What is the name of the Vice President of the United States now?
If the president can no longer serve, who becomes president?
Name one power of the president.
Who is Commander-in-Chief of the U.S. military?
Who signs bills to become laws?
Who vetoes bills?
Who appoints federal judges?
The executive branch has many parts. Name one.
What does the President's Cabinet do?
answers: Advises the president (of the United States).

questions.question: What are two Cabinet-level positions?
answers: Secretary of Health and Human Services
Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

questions.question: Why is the Electoral College Important?
answers: It decides who is elected president.
It provides a compromise between the popular election of the president and congressional selection.

questions.question: What is one part of the judicial branch?
What does the judicial branch do?
answers: Decides if a law goes against the (U.S.) Constitution.

questions.question: What is the highest court in the United States?
How many seats are on the Supreme Court?
How many Supreme Court justices are usually needed to decide a case?
How long do Supreme Court justices serve?
Supreme Court justices serve for life. Why?
Who is the Chief Justice of the United States now?
Name one power that is only for the federal government.
Name one power that is only for the states.
What is the purpose of the 10th Amendment?
answers: (It states that the) powers not given to the federal government belong to the states or to the people.

questions.question: Who is the governor of your state now?
What is the capital of your state?
There are four amendments to the U.S. Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.
answers: You don�t have to pay (a poll tax) to vote.
Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)
A male citizen of any race (can vote).

questions.question: Who can vote in federal elections, run for federal office, and serve on a jury in the United States?
What are three rights of everyone living in the United States?
What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
Name two promises that new citizens make in the Oath of Allegiance.
answers: Give up loyalty to other countries
Obey the laws of the United States
Serve (help, do important work for) the nation (if needed)
Be loyal to the United States

questions.question: How can people become United States citizens?
answers: Be born in the United States

questions.question: What are two examples of civic participation in the United States?
answers: Give an elected official your opinion (on an issue)
Support or oppose an issue or policy

questions.question: What is one way Americans can serve their country?
answers: Work for local, state, or federal government

questions.question: Why is it important to pay federal taxes?
answers: All people pay to fund the federal government

questions.question: It is important for all men age 18 through 25 to register for the Selective Service. Name one reason why.
answers: Makes the draft fair, if needed

questions.question: The colonists came to America for many reasons. Name one.
Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived?
What group of people was taken and sold as slaves?
What war did the Americans fight to win independence from Britain?
Name one reason why the Americans declared independence from Britain.
answers: British soldiers stayed in Americans' houses (boarding, quartering)

questions.question: Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?
When was the Declaration of Independence adopted?
The American Revolution had many important events. Name one.
answers: Washington Crossing the Delaware (Battle of Trenton)

questions.question: There were 13 original states. Name five.
What founding document was written in 1787?
The Federalist Papers supported the passage of the U.S. Constitution. Name one of the writers.
Why were the Federalist Papers important?
answers: They helped people understand the (U.S.) Constitution.

questions.question: Benjamin Franklin is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: Founded the first free public libraries
First Postmaster General of the United States
Helped write the Declaration of Independence

questions.question: George Washington is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: First president of the United States

questions.question: Thomas Jefferson is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: Writer of the Declaration of Independence
Third president of the United States
Doubled the size of the United States (Louisiana Purchase)
Writer of the Virginia Statute on Religious Freedom

questions.question: James Madison is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: Fourth president of the United States
One of the writers of the Federalist Papers

questions.question: Alexander Hamilton is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: One of the writers of the Federalist Papers
Helped establish the First Bank of the United States

questions.question: What territory did the United States buy from France in 1803?
Name one war fought by the United States in the 1800s.
Name the U.S. war between the North and the South.
The Civil War had many important events. Name one.
Abraham Lincoln is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: Led the United States during the Civil War

questions.question: What did the Emancipation Proclamation do?
answers: Freed slaves in the Confederate states
Freed slaves in most Southern states

questions.question: What U.S. war ended slavery?
What amendment gives citizenship to all persons born in the United States?
When did all men get the right to vote?
Name one leader of the women's rights movement in the 1800s.
Name one war fought by the United States in the 1900s.
Why did the United States enter World War I?
answers: To support the Allied Powers (England, France, Italy, and Russia).
To oppose the Central Powers (Germany, Austria-Hungary, the Ottoman Empire, and Bulgaria).

questions.question: When did all women get the right to vote?
What was the Great Depression?
answers: Longest economic recession in modern history

questions.question: When did the Great Depression start?
Who was president during the Great Depression and World War II?
Why did the United States enter World War II?
answers: To support the Allied Powers (England, France, and Russia)
To oppose the Axis Powers (Germany, Italy, and Japan)

questions.question: Dwight Eisenhower is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: President at the end of (during) the Korean War
Signed the Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1956 (Created the Interstate System)

questions.question: Who was the United States' main rival during the Cold War?
During the Cold War, what was one main concern of the United States?
Why did the United States enter the Korean War?
answers: To stop the spread of communism.

questions.question: Why did the United States enter the Vietnam War?
answers: To stop the spread of communism.

questions.question: What did the civil rights movement do?
Martin Luther King, Jr. is famous for many things. Name one.
answers: Worked for equality for all Americans
Worked to ensure that people would 'not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character'

questions.question: Why did the United States enter the Persian Gulf War?
answers: To force the Iraqi military from Kuwait.

questions.question: What major event happened on September 11, 2001 in the United States?
answers: Terrorists took over two planes and crashed them into the World Trade Center in New York City.
Terrorists took over a plane and crashed into the Pentagon in Arlington, Virginia.
Terrorists took over a plane originally aimed at Washington, D.C., and crashed in a field in Pennsylvania.

questions.question: Name one U.S. military conflict after the September 11, 2001 attacks.
Name one Native American tribe in the United States.
answers: For a complete list of tribes, please visit bia.gov.

questions.question: Name one example of an American innovation.
What is the capital of the United States?
Where is the Statue of Liberty?
answers: Liberty Island [Also acceptable are New Jersey, near New York City, and on the Hudson (River)

questions.question: Why does the flag have 13 stripes?
answers: (Because the stripes) represent the original colonies

questions.question: Who does the flag have 50 stars?
answers: (Because there is) one star for each state

questions.question: What is the name of the national anthem?
The Nation's first motto was 'E Pluribus Unum'. What does that mean?
What is Independence Day?
answers: A holiday to celebrate U.S. independence (from Britain)

questions.question: Name three National U.S. Holidays.
What is Memorial Day?
answers: A holiday to honor soldiers who died in military service.

questions.question: What is Veterans Day?
answers: A holiday to honor people in the (U.S.) military
A holiday to honor people who have served (in the U.S. military)
